did.unittitle: Office of the Dean of Arts and Sciences Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Dean of the School of Arts and Sciences

did.abstract: The collection documents the activities of the Office of the Dean of Arts and Sciences. This collection contains correspondence, appointment books, reports submitted to the Office, faculty information sheets, building and construction plans, and meeting minutes from 2001 to the 2010s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into eleven series: Correspondence; Appointment books; Building and construction plans and projects; Reports; Faculty information sheets; Subject files; Meeting minutes; Orientation; Faculty forum and events; Additional accessions; and 2020 accessions.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: UA045, Office of the Dean of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering, TARC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Office of the Dean of Arts and Sciences was created in 2001 from a division of the Office of the Dean of Arts, Sciences and Engineering. The Dean of Arts and Sciences is responsible for all undergraduate and graduate departments and programs, as well as research centers and institutes under the scope of Arts and Sciences. The School of Arts and Sciences comprises the College of Liberal Arts, the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, as well as the College of Special Studies.

The Office of the Dean of Arts and Sciences reports to the Office of the University Provost/Senior Vice President. The Dean of Arts and Sciences works closely with a Leadership Team comprised of Deans of Academic Affairs and Education at both the undergraduate and the graduate level.

Susan Ernst served as Dean of Liberal Arts and Jackson College for Natural and Social Sciences from 1997 to the split of the Office in 2001. In 2001 she was named the Dean of Arts and Sciences, a position she held until 2005. Kevin Dunn served as Assistant Dean of Academic Affairs within the Office of the Dean of Arts and Sciences from 2002-2005.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: This collection is partially minimally processed. In particular, series 10 and 11 may require review before being made available for use. Please contact TARC for further details.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Tufts Archival Research Center website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the activities of the Office of the Dean of Arts and Sciences. This collection contains correspondence, appointment books, reports submitted to the Office, faculty information sheets, building and construction plans, and meeting minutes from 2001 to the 2010s. Significant topics include matriculation; donor relations; Task Forces; Faculty Forum and other events; New Faculty and New Chair Orientation sessions; and Special projects.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Office of the Dean of Arts and Sciences Records, 1964 -- 2011.Tufts University. Tufts Archival Research Center. Medford, MA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of correspondence generated from the Office of the Dean of Arts and Sciences. The bulk of the correspondence is thank you letters to donors.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 20 years from date of creation. Open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains appointment books from the Office of the Dean of Arts, Sciences. Multiple Deans within the Office of the Dean of Arts and Sciences are represented in this series. The appointment books of Susan Ernst, whose term within the Office covers both before and after the split of the Office, are housed in this collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged chronologically by Dean.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of construction plans and reports for building and construction projects related to Arts and Sciences Departments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The folder contains annual reports from the Dean of Academic Affairs, Administration and Finance, Dean of the Graduate School, Dean of the Undergraduate School, the Diversity Office, and the Provost

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is composed of Faculty Information Sheets. The Faculty Information Sheets are records completed by faculty members to report their class loads, research goals and progress, and current publications to the Office of the Dean of Arts and Sciences for each academic year. These records primarily start in 2001, the year the Office of the Dean of Arts, Sciences and Engineering split into two separate offices, but some records predate the split. Due to the close relationship of the records to each other and arrangement at the time they were received, DCA decided not to separate the records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of subject files related to special projects.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Office of the Dean of the School of Arts and Sciences, 2020, accession UA-2021-017.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series was damaged by heat and water prior to its transfer to TARC. Materials were treated for mold by Polygon Corporation in 2020. Mold is no longer present but some materials are permanently discolored by water damage.

Processing was begun on this series in 2021 by Qing Qing Pan, Archives Assistant. At that time, the materials were re-boxed and placed in archival folders where needed. Minimal processing was completed in 2023 by Kate McNally, Records and Accessioning Archivist, and a box-level inventory was produced. Digital media was removed for stabilization, and two folders of staff search materials were removed for confidential destruction as required by university retention policies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains strategic planning, accreditation, and departmental review files. Also included are development records and program files. These records were produced by the Office of the Dean of the School of Arts and Sciences at Tufts, and the bulk of the materials date from 1984-2010.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Two folders of materials containing staff employment search materials were removed from this series and securely destroyed in February 2023, in accordance with University record retention guidelines.
